In Delusions of Grandeur, people speak about a world where "everyone has an opinion." But in reality, the world's opinions are mostly just the result of the people's own self-absorption and the media's manipulation. In this novel, the author explores how people's opinions can be influenced by the media, and how it can lead to societal dysfunction if not corrected.
